title: Invasion of Poland
summary: Germany invades Poland using Blitzkrieg tactics, marking the official start of WWII in Europe. Britain and France declare war on Germany two days later.
facts: First use of coordinated tank and air attacks (Blitzkrieg)
Soviet Union invaded from east on September 17

title: Britain & France Declare War
summary: Following Germany's invasion of Poland, Britain and France honor their alliance commitments and declare war on Germany.
facts: Australia, New Zealand also declared war

title: Fall of France
summary: France surrenders to Germany after just 6 weeks of fighting. The Vichy government is established in unoccupied southern France.
facts: Free French forces continued fight under de Gaulle

title: Battle of Britain
summary: The RAF successfully defends Britain against sustained German Luftwaffe attacks, preventing invasion and marking Hitler's first major defeat.
facts: First major military campaign fought entirely by air forces
Churchill: 'Never was so much owed by so many to so few'

title: Operation Barbarossa
summary: Germany launches massive invasion of Soviet Union, opening the Eastern Front. Largest military operation in history.

title: Attack on Pearl Harbor
summary: Japan launches surprise attack on US naval base at Pearl Harbor, Hawaii. Brings United States into WWII.
facts: 353 Japanese aircraft attacked in two waves
Roosevelt: 'A date which will live in infamy'
US declared war on Japan December 8

title: Battle of Midway
summary: US Navy defeats Japan in decisive Pacific battle, crippling Japanese carrier fleet and shifting Pacific War momentum.
facts: 4 Japanese carriers sunk in one day

title: Battle of Stalingrad
summary: Brutal urban warfare as Soviet forces halt German advance. Turning point on Eastern Front with massive casualties on both sides.

title: Battle of El Alamein
summary: British victory in North Africa turns tide against Axis forces, beginning long retreat from Africa.
facts: Marked beginning of Axis retreat in Africa
Churchill: 'Not the end, not even the beginning of the end, but perhaps the end of the beginning'

title: German Surrender at Stalingrad
summary: Complete Soviet victory marks major turning point. German 6th Army destroyed, devastating Nazi war machine.

title: Battle of Kursk
summary: Largest tank battle in history. Soviet victory ends German offensive capability on Eastern Front.

title: Italy Surrenders
summary: Italy surrenders unconditionally and switches to Allied side after invasion of Sicily and mainland.

title: D-Day (Operation Overlord)
summary: Massive Allied amphibious invasion of Normandy opens Western Front. Largest seaborne invasion in history.
facts: 5 beach landing zones: Utah, Omaha, Gold, Juno, Sword
Beginning of the end for Nazi Germany

title: Liberation of Paris
summary: Allied forces liberate Paris from four years of German occupation. Free French forces lead entry into city.
facts: Free French 2nd Armored Division led liberation
Hitler ordered city destroyed, order not followed

title: Battle of the Bulge
summary: Germany's last major offensive in the West. Surprise attack creates 'bulge' in Allied lines before being repelled.
facts: Largest battle fought by US Army

title: Yalta Conference
summary: Roosevelt, Churchill, and Stalin meet to plan post-war Europe and final assault on Germany.
facts: Soviet entry into Pacific War agreed

title: Battle of Berlin
summary: Final major European battle. Soviet forces capture Berlin after intense urban combat.

title: V-E Day (Victory in Europe)
summary: Germany surrenders unconditionally, ending WWII in Europe after six years of devastating conflict.
facts: Celebrated May 8 in West, May 9 in Soviet Union

title: Atomic Bombs Dropped
summary: USA drops atomic bombs on Hiroshima (Aug 6) and Nagasaki (Aug 9), ushering in atomic age.
facts: First and only combat use of nuclear weapons

title: V-J Day (Victory over Japan)
summary: Japan announces surrender, ending WWII. Formal ceremony held September 2 aboard USS Missouri.
facts: Emperor Hirohito announced surrender via radio
Reshaped global order and led to Cold War
